node.title: Two kidnapped US missionaries freed amidst kidnapping epidemic in Haiti
node.alt: An old rusty and faded sign with the words Christian Aid Ministries in front of their logo of a cross and world map.
node.description: More than 800 people have been kidnapped for ransom since the start of 2021 in Haiti, with the United States and Canada warning citizens to leave the country over fears they could be targeted.
node.content:
["Two of 17 members of a missionary group who were kidnapped more than a month ago have been freed in Haiti and are safe.", "Their Ohio-based church organisation said the freed missionaries were \"in good spirits and being cared for.\"\u00a0", "Christian Aid Ministries issued a statement saying it could not give the names of those released, why they were freed or other information.", "\"While we rejoice at this release, our hearts are with the 15 people who are still being held,\" the group said.", "The missionaries were kidnapped by the 400 Mawozo gang on October 16.\u00a0", "There are five children in the group of 16 US\u00a0citizens and one Canadian, including an 8-month-old.", "Their Haitian driver also was abducted, according to a local human rights organisation.", "The leader of the 400 Mawozo gang has threatened to kill the hostages unless his demands are met.", "Authorities have said the gang was demanding $1.34 million per person, although it wasn't immediately clear that included the children in the group.", "The spokesman for Haiti's National Police, Gary Desrosiers, confirmed that two hostages were released on Sunday local time.", "The FBI, which is helping Haitian authorities recover the captives, declined to comment.", "
Frequent kidnappings
", "More than 800 people have been kidnapped for ransom since January in Haiti, according to the Center for Analysis and Research in Human Rights.\u00a0", "Since December 2020, Haitian police have sought the gang's leader, Wilson Joseph, for crimes including assassination, kidnapping, vehicle theft and hijacking of cargo trucks.", "Haiti's recent surge in kidnappings throws into sharp relief the increased domination of gangs over the country, which law enforcement agencies cannot contain.", "Gangs have seized effective control of much of Port-au-Prince, which has been under an intensifying political crisis, particularly with the assassination of President Jovenel Moise in in July.", "The United States has advised Americans not to travel to Haiti due to kidnappings they say regularly target American citizens.", "Last week, both the United States and Canada additionally recommended that their nationals living in the country leave.", "Canada also announced it was pulling all but essential personnel from its embassy.", "
Haiti suffers\u00a0devastation after\u00a0devastation
", "The country is still recovering\u00a0from the political shock of Mr Moise's assassination\u00a0and a 7.2 magnitude earthquake that struck in mid-August, killing more than 2,200 people and destroying tens of thousands of homes.", "The country is also dealing with a fuel shortage blamed on gangs blocking petrol\u00a0distribution terminals.", "The shortage had\u00a0forced hospitals to turn away patients and paralysed public transportation, with some schools closing and businesses shortening their work hours.", "Wires/ABC"]
